_comment: Created by ianb on 08/06/2015 16:34:15 using v2.6
title: How have the number of maternities changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The absolute number of maternities where it is known that the woman is a smoker at time of birth has also been decreasing. In 2013/14 a bit less than 76,000 women were known to be smokers, a decrease of nearly 15,000 since 2006/07. However, the total number of maternities has also been decreasing since 2011/12.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Women's Smoking Status at Time of Delivery
